oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Feedlot gastrointestinal parasite control and anthelmintic treatment options, a review
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Edmonds, Matthew D.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Anthelmintics are an important tool in the feedlot industry. The goal of this review article is to provide the veterinary practitioner with a short summary of the important aspects of internal gastrointestinal parasite control in the feedlot. A review of economically significant gastrointestinal nematodes and the bovine liver fluke is provided, along with a discussion of treatment options and an anthelmintic efficacy assessment. Important aspects unique to the feedlot environment are addressed, including anthelmintic resistance and combination anthelmintic therapies.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: The Bovine Practitioner; Vol. 47, No. 2 (2013 Summer); 120-123
